data.title: Android setMultipleTouchEnabled
data.body:
On iOS switching between single or multitouch app is done with a single call to `[eaglView setMultipleTouchEnabled:NO];` but there is no simple equivalent on Android.

This PR adds this feature to `Cocos2dxGLSurfaceView` which can then be easily called on `AppActivity` with `this.getGLSurfaceView().setMultipleTouchEnabled(false);`.

This is a recurring situation that has been discussed [here](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/disabling-multitouch-in-android/9649/3), [here](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/single-touch-problem/17921/7) and [here](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/about-the-single-touch-by-android/17957). There was also an very similar PR #4654 that was closed but not merged.

data.title: FrameBuffer multisampling support
data.body:
Can someone please add multisampling support for **experimental::FrameBuffer** and render target to texture!? I think it's really awesome feature for post processing.
I have tried to do it by myself but always get opengl error 0x0506.

Can please someone help me?

data.title: Let FMOD autodetect the best output mode for Linux
data.body:
@filippovdaniil is right. Letting FMOD autodetect the best output mode makes it work with ALSA as well as PulseAudio. I tested this in Arch Linux and @filippovdaniil tested it in Debian. 

Related: Issue #16627

data.title: cocos2dInternal cleaned of some warnings
data.body: Cleaned of most unused parameters and signed-unsigned comparisons warnings found with gcc-6.2

data.title: May want to use rmdir/remove/nftw instead of system() for remove directory
data.body:
Either use unlink while recursively readdir. Or I think the nftw code from the Apple-specific file utils may work for Linux as well?

While Stackoverflow is not the best to use for final code, here's topics for reference.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5467725/how-to-delete-a-directory-and-its-contents-in-posix-c
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3184445/how-to-clear-directory-contents-in-c-on-linux-basically-i-want-to-do-rm-rf
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2256945/removing-a-non-empty-directory-programmatically-in-c-or-c

data.title: rapidjson::FileStream should be replace with rapidjson::FileReadStream
data.body: This issue may cause compile error when executing cocos gen-libs

data.title: [Improve]use STL emplace when possible
data.body:
* replaced some unordered_map::insert(std::make_pair(foo, bar)) with unordered_map::emplace(foo, bar)
* replaced some vector::push_back(std::make_pair(foo, bar)) with vector::emplace_back(foo, bar)

The old way will construct a std::pair first then call move constructor when putting it into the container, while using emplace will construct the pair in-place in the container which will make it a little bit faster. Also, the emplace way is shorter & more concise.

data.title: CCFileUtils' thread safety improvement
data.body:
Since FileUtils is not designed as thread safe, when multiple threads are trying to resolve some paths in the file system, the cache table inside it might cause a crash. Currently we have been getting quite a lot crash logs caused by this.

A straight forward fix for this is to add a mutex but this will require a lot of change in the code, and will cause much overhead for programs that mainly use FileUtils in main thread.

There's a much easier solution to this(only change 2 lines): 

> Add a [`thread_local`](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/keyword/thread_local) specifier for the `FileUtils::s_sharedFileUtils`

This makes each thread that uses FileUtils have their own instances.

If an app does not use FileUtils in multiple threads, then `getInstance` will only be called in main thread and only main thread will hold a FileUtils instance so it will behave exactly the same as the current implementation.

Please let me know what you think, I can create a PR right after. Thanks. @minggo

data.title: [ci skip]fix typo
No CC_UNUSED_PARAM
data.body:
In #16774 I tried to make cocos2d-x more consistent in the use of CC_UNUSED_PARAM but to keep the code more simple and cleaner it was suggested it might be better to just ignore this type of warning.

This PR adds the -Wno-unused-parameter (which is turned on in DEBUG with -Wextra) and removed all the uses of the macro CC_UNUSED_PARAM. The macro itself is kept as it might be in use by some game devs in their own code.

data.title: jsb.fileUtils.getStringFromFile cause crash when read big file.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.10
- devices test on:android redmi note3
- developing environments
   - NDK version:r10e
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. some base code, such as hotupdate, create base folder etc. 
2. jsb.fileUtils.isFileExist("path to big json file") then crash

The crash not happen every time, but  occurred about  30%-50% .

Can we have a callback when read file?
